title: Safe Trading and Bartering with Locals
brief: How to trade effectively and safely with local populations for supplies.
steps: Step 1: Use salt, tobacco, silver money, matches, razor blades, empty containers, or cloth - these may be worth more than paper money in isolated areas.
Step 2: Use hard coin for its exchange value or as jewelry/trinkets.
Step 3: Do not overpay as it may lead to embarrassment and danger.
Step 4: Make some kind of payment for all food, supplies, and services received.
Step 5: Accept what locals offer and share it equally with all present.
Step 6: Eat in the same way they eat and try to eat all they offer.
warnings: Never take anything without offering payment.
Some peoples will seriously reduce their own supplies to feed strangers - be mindful of this.
